summary: Website for live streaming from a single authorized broadcaster to viewers with code-based access (fixed session code), featuring a football-themed UI with real-time game/event controls plus an on-camera (over-video) bottom scoreboard overlay on both broadcaster and viewer views, including team icons/scores and a small "VillanSpoon" label in the scoreboard corner.
architectural_notes: Add a 'single-broadcaster' rule: only the owner can create/start the live session; viewers are view-only.
Support a fixed session code ('pinedo') for the primary broadcast flow (no code generation needed for this mode).
Render scoreboard UI as an overlay on the video element/stream (bottom of camera) for both broadcaster preview and viewer playback; remove the separate bottom-of-screen scorebar UI.
Flag events should render as a temporary on-video overlay (team + reason) visible to both broadcaster and viewers.
Score updates should be set via manual entry controls (no +1 point button) and persisted so viewers see updates.
Scoreboard overlay: reduce overlay height (smaller vertical footprint) while keeping it on-video for both broadcaster and viewer.
Flag overlay: show the entered reason; position the overlay on the selected team’s side (left/right); auto-hide after 3 seconds.
Scoreboard overlay should display a one-word team name mapped from the selected icon: fist→Titans, tornado→Twisters, bullfrog→Bullfrogs, dolphin→Dolphins.
Score editing controls: keep manual score entry AND add +/− adjustment buttons in the same broadcaster score edit panel.
Add an offense indicator arrow to the scoreboard overlay; broadcaster can toggle which team is on offense from the score edit panel and viewers see updates in real time.
known_issues: Previous build attempt failed with: "AI was unable to complete your request."
Flag overlay is not auto-dismissing (currently lasts indefinitely) despite intended 3-second timeout.
Viewers cannot currently hear broadcaster audio (stream likely missing or not sending microphone audio track reliably).
Viewers see a black screen (video not rendering/received) when broadcaster is live.
Subtitles are being generated from the viewer’s own microphone instead of the broadcaster’s mic audio.

existing_features.title: Create a football-themed UI and layout used consistently across the app (colors, typography, spacing, and components) with a distinct style appropriate for a live football broadcast control room.
Implement a viewer access gate where viewers must enter a valid session code before they can watch a live broadcast.
Implement a broadcaster (mobile-friendly) page that can capture live video/audio from the phone camera/microphone and start/stop a live session associated with a shareable session code.
Implement live streaming delivery from broadcaster to viewers using an in-browser real-time protocol with backend-assisted session signaling and state (no third-party streaming providers).

Add a football control panel for the broadcaster with clearly labeled buttons for common game events (at minimum: Flag and Point/Score), and publish these events to viewers in real time (e.g., as an on-screen overlay and/or an event feed).
Create frontend pages and navigation for (1) Broadcaster mode and (2) Viewer mode, optimized for mobile use on the broadcaster side and simple viewing on the viewer side.
Add basic safety/validation states: missing permissions, unsupported browser features, and session lifecycle states (not started, live, ended).
Render generated image assets (football-themed background and simple UI icons) from static files under frontend/public/assets/generated and use them in the UI.

Render a fixed bottom-of-screen scorebar on the Viewer Watch page that displays both teams’ selected icons and current scores, and ensure it remains visible while watching (sticky footer-style overlay that does not block core controls).

Add broadcaster UI controls to set each team’s icon (restricted to exactly: dolphin, bullfrog, fist, tornado) and to adjust each team’s score during a live session; persist changes to the backend so viewers see updates.
Use generated static image assets for the four allowed team icons and display them in the icon selection UI and in the bottom scorebar.
Replace the Viewer Watch page’s fixed bottom-of-screen scorebar with an on-camera (over-video) bottom scoreboard overlay rendered inside the video container, visible while watching.
Add the text label "VillanSpoon" in the left corner of the on-camera scoreboard overlay on BOTH the broadcaster camera preview and the viewer stream view.
Change broadcaster score editing to manual score entry (no +/− buttons) while keeping live-updating custom scores persisted to the backend.
Remove the "Score" / point button from the broadcaster game controls so the broadcaster cannot add a point/score event via that button.

Update the broadcaster "Flag" control to require selecting which team the flag applies to and entering a reason, then publish that flag announcement so it appears as an on-camera overlay over the video (visible to both broadcaster and viewers).
Ensure the viewer’s latest-event presentation is on-camera (over-video) rather than a separate card below the video when an event arrives (especially flags).

Reduce the on-camera bottom scoreboard overlay height (make it smaller vertically) on both the broadcaster camera preview and the viewer watch video, without changing its width or removing any existing content (team icons, scores, and the "VillanSpoon" label).

Update the flag announcement on-camera overlay to appear on the side of the video corresponding to the selected team: if the flag event team is "Team A" then render the overlay on the left side; if the team is "Team B" then render it on the right side.

Make flag announcement overlays automatically dismiss after 3 seconds while still displaying the entered reason text; ensure viewers and the broadcaster both stop seeing the overlay after ~3 seconds without requiring manual action.
Fix the flag announcement overlay so it reliably auto-dismisses after ~3 seconds on BOTH the broadcaster camera preview and the viewer watch video (it must not persist indefinitely).

Make the on-camera bottom scoreboard overlay even smaller vertically on both broadcaster and viewer views, without changing its width and without removing any existing content (team icons, scores, and the "VillanSpoon" label).

Update the on-camera scoreboard overlay to display a one-word team name derived from the selected team icon, using exactly these mappings: fist → "Titans", tornado → "Twisters", bullfrog → "Bullfrogs", dolphin → "Dolphins". Do not display multi-word names for these teams.

Update the broadcaster Scoreboard Controls panel to keep manual score entry and also provide + and − buttons for Team A and Team B that adjust the corresponding score without allowing scores to go below 0, and include an in-panel control to select which team is on offense.

Render an offense arrow indicator on the on-camera scoreboard overlay pointing to the team that is currently marked as on offense, and show it consistently in both the broadcaster camera preview and the viewer watch video overlay.

Update the on-camera scoreboard overlay to remove the "VS" divider and replace it with a single offense arrow placed exactly centered between the two teams; the arrow must point toward the team currently marked as on offense (left when Team A is on offense, right when Team B is on offense), and the arrow must remain centered regardless of screen size.

Change the broadcaster Flag Event UI and the resulting flag overlay text to use the current teams’ mapped names (Titans/Twisters/Bullfrogs/Dolphins) derived from the selected team icons, instead of showing generic labels "Team A" and "Team B".

Add a required pre-live setup step on the broadcaster start flow where the broadcaster must select Team A and Team B icons (restricted to the existing four allowed icons) before they can start the broadcast; once the session starts, persist the chosen team icons to the backend scoreboard immediately so viewers see the correct teams from the beginning.

Implement optional automatic subtitles for viewers using the browser’s built-in speech-to-text capabilities (no external services): add a viewer-facing toggle to enable/disable subtitles and display the recognized text as a caption overlay within the video container when enabled; show a clear unsupported message when the browser does not support the required speech recognition API.

Ensure the broadcaster stream captures and transmits microphone audio so viewers can hear the broadcaster reliably during a live session (i.e., the outgoing stream must include an audio track when mic is enabled).
Add a broadcaster mic on/off toggle control during live streaming, defaulting to mic ON when the broadcast starts, and make the toggle immediately affect whether microphone audio is sent to viewers.
Update broadcaster-side permission/error handling to cover microphone access (in addition to camera), including clear English messaging when mic is blocked/unavailable and guidance to enable it.
Fix the Viewer Watch experience so viewers can see the broadcaster’s live camera video instead of a black/empty screen when the session lifecycle is live.
Fix broadcaster-to-viewer audio so that when the broadcaster mic toggle is ON, viewers reliably hear the broadcaster during a live session.
Change subtitles so that viewer subtitles reflect the broadcaster’s speech (broadcaster microphone) rather than the viewer’s own microphone.
Update the Viewer Watch subtitles UI to consume broadcaster-published captions (polling via React Query) and display them using the existing in-video caption overlay styling.

Replace the current placeholder viewer live-stream implementation so that viewers can actually connect to and play the broadcaster’s live stream when a session is in the "live" lifecycle state (no forced "Stream Unavailable" simulation).

Ensure the broadcaster-to-viewer streaming pipeline is fully implemented end-to-end, including session-scoped signaling/state in the Motoko backend if required, so that a viewer joining with a valid session code can establish a working in-browser real-time connection to the broadcaster (video + audio).
Fix broadcaster-to-viewer audio so that when the broadcaster mic toggle is ON, the outgoing stream includes an enabled audio track and viewers can reliably hear the broadcaster during a live session.

Move the subtitles/captions overlay to the top of the video (inside the video container) for BOTH the broadcaster camera preview and the viewer watch view, while keeping existing styling readable over video.

new_feature_requests.summary: Mobile live video capture and streaming to a web audience
Viewer access control via entry code (only users with a code can watch)
Football-themed UI with event buttons to record game actions (e.g., flags, points)
Persist session metadata and event logs in the backend so that viewers who join mid-stream can immediately see the current session state and recent events after joining with the code.
Support a single shared broadcast/session with a fixed viewer access code (“pinedo”)
Restrict broadcasting to the owner/only one broadcaster can start the session
Allow selecting team icons only from a limited set (dolphin, bullfrog, fist, tornado)
Add persistent per-session scoreboard state that includes (a) two team scores and (b) each team’s selected icon, and expose backend methods to update and fetch this scoreboard state by session code.
Replace the bottom-of-screen scorebar with an on-camera (over-video) bottom scoreboard overlay visible to both broadcaster and viewers
Change score controls to manual score entry (remove the +1 point button) while keeping live-updating custom scores
Show flag announcements (team + reason) as an overlay on top of the video (on-camera), visible to both broadcaster and viewers
Add a "VillanSpoon" label/watermark in the left corner of the scoreboard overlay (both broadcaster and viewer)
Reduce the on-camera scoreboard overlay height (make scoreboard smaller vertically)
Flag overlay should show the entered reason, appear on the selected team’s side (left/right), and auto-dismiss after 3 seconds
Show a one-word team name on the scoreboard derived from the selected team icon (fist→Titans, tornado→Twisters, bullfrog→Bullfrogs, dolphin→Dolphins)
Keep manual score entry but also add +/− buttons for adjusting points in the broadcaster score edit panel
Add a broadcaster-selectable offense indicator (arrow pointing to the team on offense) shown on the on-camera scoreboard overlay; selector located in the same score edit panel

Extend the per-session scoreboard state to include which team is currently on offense, and expose this value via existing scoreboard fetch/update flows so both broadcaster and viewers receive it when polling the scoreboard.
Center the offense arrow in the middle of the scoreboard overlay by replacing the 'VS' separator; arrow points left/right toward the team currently on offense
Require a pre-live setup step where the broadcaster must select Team A and Team B (from the four allowed team icons) before starting the stream
Display flag announcements using the current teams’ mapped names (Titans/Twisters/Bullfrogs/Dolphins) instead of generic 'Team A/B'
Add automatic subtitles (speech-to-text captions) for viewers, implemented as an optional/toggleable feature
Fix broadcaster audio so viewers can hear the broadcaster reliably (ensure mic audio is captured and sent with the stream)
Add a broadcaster mic on/off toggle during live streaming (defaults to mic ON at start)
Add backend support for broadcaster-sourced caption delivery so viewers can fetch the latest caption text for a given session code (no third-party services).
Move subtitles/captions overlay to the top of the video (inside video) for both broadcaster preview and viewer watch views
